definition[0]: someone’s education, achievements, experience etc that prove they have the ability to do something
example[0]: He spent the first part of the interview trying to establish his credentials as a financial expert.
example[1]: Her academic credentials include an MA and a PhD.
example[2]: She had excellent credentials for the job.
example[3]: There are doubts over his credentials as a future prime minister.
definition[1]: a letter or other document which proves your good character or your right to have a particular position
example[4]: The commissioner presented his credentials to the State Department.
definition[2]: the training, education, or experience that give you the ability to do a particular job or task well, especially in the opinion of other people
example[5]: You’ll be given a three-month probationary period to fully establish your credentials as an accountant.
definition[3]: a letter or other document that proves that someone is who they say they are or has the ability to do a particular job or task
example[6]: Swiss police checked the drivers’ credentials before allowing them to pick up the delegates.
